questions.text: What did Cyd Sherman name her in-game character?
questions.explanation:
Codex.

	All four options are members of her character's guild in the game. Codex was a cleric class (or healer) character in the game. Cyd talked to her webcam about how "cool" it would be to be a princess as she was creating the character, but that wasn't an option.

questions.text: What did Cyd do for a living when she wasn't playing her game?
questions.explanation:
Violinist.

	Cyd was shown with the local orchestra carrying her instrument in several panels. She mentioned on several occasions that she wasn't the first chair and instead was "in the back" of the group. She was shy and had few friends in the orchestra.

questions.text: What was the name of Trevor's band?
questions.explanation:
The Shredders.

	Trevor had been dating Cyd for about six months at the start of the first issue. Before quitting he had been a cellist in the same orchestra as Cyd.

questions.text: Who was the first future guild member that Cyd met in the game?
questions.explanation:
Bladezz.

	Playing as Codex, she met Bladezz and one of his school classmates just a few minutes after she first logged into the game. Bladezz later dumped his friend after a fight and joined up with Codex and her friends as they founded the guild.  Bladezz was an impulsive player who was as often the reason a quest failed as the reason it succeeded.

questions.text: What nickname did Trevor called Cyd?
questions.explanation:
Little Bird.

	Trevor rarely referred to Cyd by her real name. If he addressed her at all he called her "Little Bird", though often in a condescending way.  Trevor seemed to only be interested in Cyd for what she could do for him, not for the sake of being in a relationship.

questions.text: What did they name the guild?
questions.explanation:
Knights of Good.

	The guild consisted of founding members, Codex, Zaboo, Vork, Bladezz, Tinkerballa and Clara. The name was suggested by Vork, who would only join if they agreed on the name. The group is made of all local players who live in the same general geographic area.

questions.text: Who wrote all of the music for Trevor's band?
questions.explanation:
Cyd.

	Cyd spent countless hours writing music and lyrics for Trevor's band. She even came up with a new name, "The Randy Bards", for them to call themselves. When a record executive came to the show, Trevor took all of the credit and effectively ended the relationship with Cyd when he didn't notice that she was within earshot as he took credit for her work.

questions.text: Cyd started a fire while she was upset.
questions.explanation:
True.

	She was upset over Trevor's betrayal, and started a small fire in the club. She wasn't intending to burn down the club, but only to burn the music sheets she had written for the the band. The trash can ended up burning up a $100,000 cello.

questions.text: Which character gave birth near the end of the third issue?
questions.explanation:
Clara.

	Clara went into labor while online with the rest of the guild members. She popped back on a few hours later from the hospital using their wireless internet. She told the other members that it was her third child in three years.

questions.text: The guild won the first contest they entered as a team.
questions.explanation:
False.

	They were slaughtered early in the competition by the top team in the region. It was during that slaughter that they realized that it was fun to play together and officially formed the guild.
